children.value: There are two main ways to register frequently-used customized configurations:
Register on the integration side by using module contribution points.
OpenSumi provides custom configuration capabilities based on OpenSumi's
mechanism. You only need to implement
For example, we can register the runtime configuration in the project by creating a
into the Providers declaration in the module, it can be used in other modules in the following way:
Another way to register is to use extensions

When integrating OpenSumi framework, we often need to perform independent configurations, and the following table lists some parameters that can be configured during the integration phase by passing in configuration items.
Also you can find the same configuration logic on
The complete configuration file can be found in the live code
The definition can be found in the
A unique name for a client, usually represent when the client starts up, and also show as the client name output by the extension process
Mainly used to register the client protocol in Electron version to promote protocol
Workspace path, usually a folder or a workspace file of
. When the value passed is empty, the file tree on the left side of the editor will show the button to open the folder.

Call after the DOM has been rendered for the first time. This means that the IDE interface has been rendered and is ready for operation, you can pass in a function here to handle the interface Loading, see
An additional specified extension path, typically for built-in extensions
Set the folder name for global storage, mainly for the folder name configuration when using the
Set the folder name for the workspace profile. For integrated environments, we recommend using
for more fine-grained configuration storage folder name Preference

A more fine-grained project workspace configuration storage location,that is, when preferenceDirName = '.sumi' ， workspacePreferenceDirName = '.kt'，the corresponding global configuration is ~/.sumi/settings.json , the workspace configuration is {workspaceDir}/.kt/settings.json

A more fine-grained project workspace configuration storage location, that is, when preferenceDirName = '.sumi' ， userPreferenceDirName = '.kt', the corresponding global configuration is ~/.sumi/settings.json , and the workspace configuration is {userDir}/.kt/settings.json
Global extension data storage directory name, .sumi by default, data stored at {userDir}/.sumi
Initial definition of the client overall configurations, and common customizable parameters includes color theme:
, which theoretically allows you to set default values for all configurations defined in the IDE
Initialized DI instances, which can be passed in generally after the external DI initialization to facilitate the initialization of some dependencies in advance
Define the default loaded modules in each layout block of the IDE, which can add, remove or change target modules.
Define the overall layout of the IDE. You can pass in a custom layout to define the default options, such as size of each block and scaling
Panel size, width/height can be defined on the basis of
Define the default panel for each block, for example:
The iframe address used to mount the webview
Default startup path of the Worker extension
Define the static resource path. The default load path within the framework is
Defines whether to start in extension development mode
Define the background image of the editor interface

Define whether ShadowDom mode is enabled in the extensiom environment. It is recommended to turn it on. After enabling ShadowDom mode, the view extension style will be isolated from the global environment

Use iframe wrap when loading workerHost. For cross-domain scenarios, the workerHost will be loaded, use base64 encoding, and will be introduced by using importScripts (importScripts are not subject to cross-domain restrictions), but this will make the origin of the workerHost be null, leaving some requests fail
Customize client ID, which is the unique identifier of the websocket service and the unique identifier passed to the backend Service that declares backServices. Be careful to keep this ID unique
Whether to disable the extension process
Extra ConfigProvider that when the ReactDOM.render call within OpenSumi, it will be wrapped by a layer of extraContextProvider for additional Context transferring effects
Allow dynamic setting of document#title by workspace path
Remote access address through which you can access container services
Enable the debugging capability of the extension process
Fetch credentials option when loading extension frontend resources, optionally "include"
The definition can be found in the
The initialized DI instance can be passed in after DI initialized externally to facilitate dependency initialization in advance
Set log placement level. The default is Info level log level
ILogService to be deprecated, set externally, replacing the default logService, which can be done by initializing
Define the maximum number of extension processes enabled
Define a custom implementation path for extension logging
Define terminal pty process exit time
Access origin allowed by static resources
Allowed path for accessing static resources. Used to configure the whitelist rule for static resources
Paths to which access is disabled by the file service, using glob to match
The extension process that stores the sock address for communication
For more configurations, please see the OpenSumi source code.
